block.p: ''A LITTLE PRINCESS,'' a musical based on the book by Frances Hodgson Burnett about a girl whose life of privilege ends with her father's death, at the Wings Theater, 154 Christopher Street, Greenwich Village. Tonight and tomorrow night at 8; Sunday at 3 p.m. Through Nov. 9. Tickets, $15. Reservations: (212) 627-2961.

''THE WIND IN THE WILLOWS,'' based on the Kenneth Grahame book, at Holy Trinity Church-Inwood, 20 Cumming Street. Presented by the Pied Piper Children's Theater of N.Y.C. Tomorrow at 3 and 7 p.m.; Sunday at 3 p.m. Tickets: $7; $4 for children under 18. Information: (212) 544-2976.
A selective listing of childrens events in the New York region this weekend.

''A LITTLE PRINCESS,'' a musical based on the book by Frances Hodgson Burnett about a girl whose life of privilege ends with her father's death, at the Wings Theater, 154 Christopher Street, Greenwich Village. Tonight and tomorrow night at 8; Sunday at 3 p.m. Through Nov. 9. Tickets, $15. Reservations: (212) 627-2961.

''THE WIND IN THE WILLOWS,'' based on the Kenneth Grahame book, at Holy Trinity Church-Inwood, 20 Cumming Street. Presented by the Pied Piper Children's Theater of N.Y.C. Tomorrow at 3 and 7 p.m.; Sunday at 3 p.m. Tickets: $7; $4 for children under 18. Information: (212) 544-2976.

''HEROES HALLOWEEN PARTY,'' where youngsters dressed as real-life or imaginary heroes will receive goody bags, tomorrow from 11:30 a.m. to 2:30 p.m. at the New York City Police Museum, 100 Old Slip, south of the South Street Seaport. In addition to games and a mock lineup, there will be tips on safe trick-or-treating. Admission: $5; $2 for ages 6 to 18. Information: (212) 480-3100, Ext. 119.

''HOWL-O-WEEN,'' Sunday from noon to 2 p.m. at the Van Cortlandt Park Dog Run and Playground, reachable from Broadway and Lakeview Place, the Bronx. Pets and owners are encouraged to come in costume, with prizes awarded for the scariest, funniest, most original and most lookalike. Information: (718) 753-6607 or (718) 430-1890.

HALLOWEEN WEEKEND IN PROSPECT PARK, Brooklyn, includes a haunted walk and carnival in the Nethermead (tomorrow at noon); scary stories at the Lefferts Historic House (tomorrow and Sunday from 1 to 4 p.m.); and a visit with several live varieties of owls at the Audubon Center (tomorrow at 2 p.m.) All events are free and reachable from the entrance at Prospect Park Southwest and 16th Street. Information: (718) 965-8999; www .prospectpark.org.

MEET THE MUSIC! opens its hourlong concert series with ''Punkitititi: Mozart's Family and Friends,'' featuring Bruce Adolphe and David Shifrin of the Chamber Music Society of Lincoln Center and members of the Society's youth ensemble. Sunday at 1 and 3 p.m. Tickets, $15. Information: (212) 875-5788.

''BOOS AT THE ZOOS,'' with face painting, storytelling, crafts and music, and treats for animals and humans this weekend at the Central Park, Prospect Park, Queens and Bronx Zoos. Festivities go on from 11 a.m. to 4 p.m. at the Central Park and Queens Zoos; noon to 4 p.m. at the Prospect Park Zoo in Brooklyn; and 10 a.m. to 5:30 p.m. at the Bronx Zoo. Admission prices and other information: Central Park Zoo, (212) 439-6500; Prospect Park Zoo, (718) 399-7339; Queens Zoo, (718) 271-1500; and Bronx Zoo, (718) 367-1010.

HALLOWEEN AT THE NEW YORK AQUARIUM, West Eighth Street and the Boardwalk, Coney Island, Brooklyn, with a carnival, face painting and a haunted pavilion, tomorrow and Sunday from 11 a.m. to 4 p.m. Admission: $11; children 2 to 12, $7; those under 2, free; youngsters in costume will be admitted free with a paying adult. Information: (718) 265-3474.

THEY MIGHT BE GIANTS, the rock group, will give a family concert tomorrow at 11 a.m. and 2 p.m. at Symphony Space, Broadway and 95th Street. Tickets: $25; $21 for members. Information: (212) 864-5400.

CHILDREN'S FALL FESTIVAL, with a haunted house, games, hayrides, music and scarecrow-making workshops. Sunday, 11 a.m. to 4 p.m. at the Queens County Farm Museum, 73-50 Little Neck Parkway, Floral Park. Admission: $3; additional $3 for the haunted house, open 1 to 7 p.m. and on Oct. 31, 4 to 7 p.m. Information: (718) 347-3276.

''MORNING OF THE GARGOYLES: A FAMILY HALLOWEEN WORKSHOP,'' with mask-making and a reading of Eve Bunting's ''Night of the Gargoyles.'' Tomorrow from 10 a.m. to noon at the Cathedral Church of St. John the Divine, Amsterdam Avenue and 112th Street, Morningside Heights. Fee, $5 per child. Information: (212) 932-7347.

''KIDS 'N' COMEDY,'' the comedy showcase for ages 8 to 15, Sunday at 3 p.m. at the Gotham Comedy Club, 34 West 22nd Street, Flatiron district. Tickets: $15, with a one-soft-drink minimum. Information: (212) 877-6115.
